Class GameCharacter

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameCharacter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Alien, Ripley
    public class GameCharacter
extends java.lang.Object

    Represents a character in the game.

    January 29, 2025

    Author:
    Abdon Morales, am226923, abdonm@cs.utexas.edu

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameCharacter

        public GameCharacter​(java.lang.String name,
                     int health,
                     int attack,
                     int speed)
        Constructor: An instance with a name, initial health, attack points, and speed
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the character.
        health - is the amount of health of the character.
        attack - is the attack/hit damage from and to the character.
        speed - is the speed of the character.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        This method get the name of the character.
        Returns:
        name

      • getHealth

        public int getHealth()
        This method gets the information about the health status of the character.
        Returns:
        health, returns the current health of the character.

      • getSpeed

        public int getSpeed()
        This method gets the information about the character's speed.
        Returns:
        speed

      • getAttack

        public int getAttack()
        This method gets the information about the character's attack damage using a getter/setter method.
        Returns:
        attack

      • hit

        public void hit​(GameCharacter target)
        Attacks the given target by reducing its health by the attack value.
        Parameters:
        target - the target parameter is the character's attempt to hit another player

      • isAlive

        public boolean isAlive()
        This method checks if the character is dead when his health is greater than 0.
        Returns:
        true or false, as it's dependent on the return of health > 0.

      • isDead

        public boolean isDead()
        This method checks if the character is dead
        Returns:
        true or false, based on what health <= 0 returns.

      • slowDown

        public void slowDown​(int speedDamage)
        Reduces the speed of the character by the given amount.
        Parameters:
        speedDamage - is the damage given from a/this character.

      • useItem

        public void useItem​(Item item)
        Increases character's attributes based on those of the item found.
        Parameters:
        item - is the item the character uses or interacts with.
